Emotional_TRUSTS.source: I would trust Hagrid with my life.

Event_WITNESSED.perspective: Annoyed and determined to stop it

Event_WITNESSED.distance: Mentioned as lending Hagrid his motorbike

Event_PARTICIPATED_IN.outcome: Tried to prevent Harry from reading the letters
Tried to prevent Harry from reading the letters
Failed to prevent Harry from winning

Event_CAUSED.method: Dumbledore leaves Harry at the Dursleys' doorstep after the death of his parents.
Harry unintentionally makes the glass disappear by talking to the snake.
McGonagall sends the letters to Harry, informing him of his acceptance to Hogwarts.
Vernon intercepts and destroys the letters.
Dumbledore sends Hagrid to deliver Harry's letter and retrieve him from the Dursleys.
Hagrid takes Harry to Diagon Alley to purchase school supplies.
Hagrid ensures Harry gets on the Hogwarts Express.
Snape jinxes Harry's broom during the match (suspected).
Hagrid acquires a dragon egg, leading to the events surrounding Norbert.
Harry, Ron, and Hermione's actions with Norbert lead to their detention in the Forbidden Forest.
Voldemort's presence in the forest causes the unicorns to be attacked.
Harry's discovery of Flamel's identity leads him to try and protect the Stone.
Hagrid reveals how to get past Fluffy.
Hermione's knowledge of Devil's Snare allows them to pass the first obstacle.
Ron's chess skills allow them to pass the chessboard challenge.

Event_AFFECTED_BY.impact: Learns about his wizarding heritage and the death of his parents.
Begins to fear the return of the Potters and their world.
Is reminded of her sister's magical abilities and fears Harry will be the same.
Is punished and confined to his cupboard.
Becomes frightened of Harry.
Is moved to Dudley's second bedroom.
Becomes increasingly paranoid and takes extreme measures to prevent Harry from receiving letters.
Is shocked and amazed by the number of letters addressed to Harry.
Learns the truth about his past and his magical abilities.
Is enraged by Hagrid's arrival and revelation.
Is forced to confront the truth about her sister and Harry's magic.
Is given a pig's tail by Hagrid's magic.
Acquires his school supplies and learns more about the wizarding world.
Meets Ron and Hermione and learns more about Hogwarts and the wizarding world.
Meets Harry and Hermione and begins a lifelong friendship.
Meets Harry and Ron and begins a lifelong friendship.
Is sorted into Gryffindor house.
Is sorted into Gryffindor house.
Is sorted into Gryffindor house.
Learns about Fluffy guarding the trapdoor.
Learns about Fluffy guarding the trapdoor.
Learns about Fluffy guarding the trapdoor.
Becomes Gryffindor's Seeker.
Is angered and humiliated by Harry's skill and acceptance onto the Quidditch team.
Learns about Voldemort drinking unicorn blood and is saved by Firenze.
Is frightened by the Forbidden Forest and the potential dangers within.
Is frightened by the Forbidden Forest and Malfoy's prank.
Confronts Quirrell and Voldemort.
Is injured by the white queen during the chess game.
Defeats Quirrell/Voldemort and is unconscious for three days.
Feels remorseful for revealing Fluffy's secret to the stranger.
Develops chronic nightmares.
Experiences increased pain from his scar.

Event_DIED_AT.impact: Motivates Harry's journey and provides backstory
Motivates Harry's journey and provides backstory

Concept_BELIEVES_IN.manifestation: Vernon questions the existence of magic and expresses disbelief in it after seeing a cat reading a map.
Dedalus Diggle celebrates the fall of Voldemort openly in the street, showing his belief in the power of wizardry.
Dumbledore uses magic openly and discusses the wizarding world with McGonagall.
McGonagall, as a witch, discusses the wizarding world and expresses concern about Muggles finding out about magic.
Hagrid arrives on a flying motorbike and mentions magical events.
Vernon dismisses Harry's dream about a flying motorbike, reflecting his disbelief in magic.
Harry initially questions whether he can be a wizard, despite Hagrid's insistence.
Hagrid reveals Harry's wizarding heritage and explains the existence of Hogwarts and the magical world.
Petunia reveals her knowledge of the wizarding world, but views it negatively and refers to magic users as "freaks."
Vernon continues to deny and reject magic, even after Hagrid's revelations.
Harry expresses wonder and excitement about Hogwarts after learning about it from Hagrid.
Hagrid speaks highly of Hogwarts and its importance in the wizarding world.
Draco Malfoy discusses house rivalry and expresses disdain for Hufflepuff.
Harry is excited about going to Hogwarts and views it as a positive escape from the Dursleys.
Vernon expresses disbelief about the existence of Platform Nine and Three-Quarters and mocks the idea of a wizarding school.
Harry, Ron, and Hermione discover that the three-headed dog is guarding the Philosopher's Stone.
Snape's interest in the three-headed dog and his actions suggest he believes in the Philosopher's Stone and its value.
Hagrid accidentally reveals that Fluffy is guarding the Philosopher's Stone.
Harry's determination to protect the Stone shows his belief in its importance and the danger it represents.
Snape's continued pursuit of the Stone reinforces his belief in its power.
Voldemort's desire to obtain the Stone demonstrates his belief in its ability to restore his power and grant immortality.
Dumbledore acknowledges the Stone's power but chooses to destroy it, recognizing its potential for harm.

Item_SEEKS.motivation: To learn about his acceptance to Hogwarts.
To prevent Voldemort from obtaining it.
To regain his full strength and power and achieve immortality.
To unlock the door to the next chamber.
To raise and care for it.
To improve Gryffindor's Quidditch team and his own flying skills.
Hagrid seeks a way to transport Norbert safely.
To learn more about his parents.
To find a new home for Norbert.
To learn what the letters say.
Neville is trying to remember what he has forgotten.
To learn about the Philosopher's Stone and Snape's intentions.
To add a dragon to his collection of creatures.

Item_DESTROYED.motivation: Prevent Harry from going to Hogwarts
Prevent Harry from going to Hogwarts

Item_USED_IN.significance: Brings Harry to his aunt and uncle's care
Silences Vernon when he insults Dumbledore
Quirrell is unable to harm Harry due to Lily's love protection
Breaks Snape's eye contact, which stops him from jinxing Harry's broom
Knocks out the troll, saving Harry and Hermione
Distracts the troll, allowing Ron to knock it out
Allows Harry to discover the Mirror of Erised
Allows Harry to retrieve Neville's Remembrall and impresses McGonagall
Harry wins the match for Gryffindor

Item_USED_IN.effectiveness: Jinxed by Snape, but ultimately effective
Item_USED_IN.significance: Harry wins the match despite Snape's interference
Allows Harry to overhear Snape and Quirrell's conversation
Reveals the connection between Flamel and the Philosopher's Stone
Neville melts Seamus's cauldron and gets boils
